grammar_rules.description: Kikuyu nouns are classified into different classes affecting agreement
examples: MA class: maaĩ (water) - no singular form

grammar_rules.description: Verbs change based on tense, aspect, and subject
Kikuyu is a tonal language where tone affects meaning
examples: Different tones can change word meanings
Mũndũ ũyũ nĩ mũrutani (This person is a teacher)
Andũ aingĩ nĩmendete rwĩmbo (Many people love music)
Nyũmba yakwa nĩ nene (My house is big)
Nyũmba ĩno ĩrĩ na tũnyũmba tũna (This house has four rooms)
Ndĩrathoma ibuku (I am reading a book)
Ciana irathoma kũu sukũũni (Children study at school)

common_errors.correct: Pay attention to high and low tones
common_errors.example: Tone affects meaning and grammatical function
Ensure adjectives agree with their nouns

common_errors.correct: Use appropriate tense and aspect markers

cultural_context: Kikuyu is spoken by the Kikuyu people of central Kenya
It's part of the Bantu language family
Respect for elders is reflected in language use
Traditional proverbs (thimo) are important in communication
